snippet.textDisplay:
@Ashadow700 

I've heard that the game does contain a lot of cliches, however, my personal opinion is that cliches don't automatically make a game bad. Sakaguchi has always been great at making sure characters are endearing and that his stories, cliched or not, capture enough feelings to make his games memorable.  A story is affected by character interactions and the creators' ability to evoke emotions, etc. That's how I personally judge a story, not merely on whether or not it's familiar to me.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Ashadow700 

I've heard that the game does contain a lot of cliches, however, my personal opinion is that cliches don't automatically make a game bad. Sakaguchi has always been great at making sure characters are endearing and that his stories, cliched or not, capture enough feelings to make his games memorable.  A story is affected by character interactions and the creators' ability to evoke emotions, etc. That's how I personally judge a story, not merely on whether or not it's familiar to me.

snippet.textDisplay: You know, I am going to be the pessimist around here and say that based on what I have seen so far of the story and characters in previews, I think this game looks like it is shaping up to become little more then yet another typical clichéd JRPG-soup. Even though I'll probably give it a try, but after FFXIII, I'm not going to get excited about anything else from Japan. If nothing else just to minimize a potential disappointment.
snippet.textOriginal: You know, I am going to be the pessimist around here and say that based on what I have seen so far of the story and characters in previews, I think this game looks like it is shaping up to become little more then yet another typical clichéd JRPG-soup. Even though I'll probably give it a try, but after FFXIII, I'm not going to get excited about anything else from Japan. If nothing else just to minimize a potential disappointment.

snippet.textDisplay:
gee, do what we did in Europe when games were not released and import them if you really want to play em. That's a thing that defines true hardcore gamers, not playing mainstream shooter games.

Anyway, seems to be Reggies fault. Iwata is responsible for Europe too and we also got Hotel Dusk 2, Another Code 2, Disaster and even Fatal Frame 4 was close to release, but Tecmo was too stubborn to fix bugs and broken controls.
He should have stayed at Nintendo marketing instead of becoming president.
snippet.textOriginal:
gee, do what we did in Europe when games were not released and import them if you really want to play em. That's a thing that defines true hardcore gamers, not playing mainstream shooter games.

Anyway, seems to be Reggies fault. Iwata is responsible for Europe too and we also got Hotel Dusk 2, Another Code 2, Disaster and even Fatal Frame 4 was close to release, but Tecmo was too stubborn to fix bugs and broken controls.
He should have stayed at Nintendo marketing instead of becoming president.
